BYLAWS OF THE NYSERTA (Continued)
2
SECTION B: Associate Membership: Any university, college, school system,
or other non-commercial organization seeking to promote non-commercial
educational radio or television may be an ASSOCIATE member and shall
be entitled to one vote on all matters of business brought before the
membership.
SECTION C: Individual Membership: Any individual engaged in educational
radio or television, in teaching radio or television courses, or any
individual seeking to promote educational radio or television may be
an INDIVIDUAL member and shall be entitled to one vote for a Trustee-
at-Large and on all other matters of business excluding votes for
additional Trustees.
ARTICLE IV
MEETINGS
SECTION A: Regular Meetings: There shall be two meetings of the Association
each year at a time and place to be determined by the Steering Committee.
One of these meetings shall be scheduled for Spring. Notification of
such meeting shall be given to all members not less than thirty days
prior to the date of the meeting.
SECTION B: Special Meetings: Special meetings of the Association may be
held at the discretion of the Steering Committee upon fifteen (15>)
days written notice to members.
SECTION C: Quorum: The membership present shall constitute a quorum.
ARTICLE V
TRUSTEES
The governing body of the Association shall be a board of trustees,
composed of not more than twenty-five (25) nor less than five (5) persons,
the specific number to be determined by a three-fourths vote of the
trustee s.
SECTION A: Method of Election: Each member of the Association shall be
entitled to vote for Trustees, except in the case of Individual
Members who may vote only for the position of Trustee-at-Large. The
first board will be assigned terms by random choice. In subsequent
elections, the candidate receiving the highest number of votes shall
be elected to serve a 3-year term. One-third of the Board shall have
their terms expire each year. Vacancies on the Board may be filled
by the Board to extend to the next meeting of the Association at which
time the membership present will elect Trustees to fill any unexpired
term. The Trustee-at-Large, always a 3-year term, will be voted upon
only by the Individual Membership.
